Nicky.Action: Falls backward into the table after being startled by Jimmy the Demon, breaking the table.
Responds to Jimmy with a light-hearted comment despite embarrassment.
Enters sheepishly, tries to avoid conflict by taking a rain check on mind wrestling.
Allows himself to be slammed and hit repeatedly without retaliation.
Enters sheepishly, tries to avoid mind wrestling, gets repeatedly slammed and hits himself with a lamp.
Smiles and winks back at Dad after Dad defends him from Cassius's mental attack.
Tries to cover up the mental attack by jokingly saying he is "re-arranging the furniture" when caught by Dad.
Allows Dad to lead and listens quietly with siblings during family storytelling.
Sheepishly raises his hand, showing vulnerability and engagement in the situation.
Says 'Don't worry about coming up with anything. It's cool.' when Dad struggles to describe him, showing tolerance and lack of resentment.

Responds to not being chosen by saying 'Hallelujah' followed by 'I mean...tough break.', indicating an attempt at humor but potentially masking disappointment; overall a forgiving and good-natured reaction.
Sheepishly raises his hand when confused, then quickly lowers it without contributing meaningfully.
Responds casually and nonchalantly to being overlooked for succession ('Don't worry about coming up with anything. It's cool.')
Appears to celebrate (says 'Hallelujah') when Dad decides to remain ruler rather than appointing a successor, showing a lack of grasp of the seriousness of the situation.
Listens and shares music with Dad, engages in playful banter and dancing.
Calls his Dad a 'good devil' and shares a laugh with him
Expresses concern by asking how bad the situation is when Dad mentions the gates are broken
Responds calmly to the Gatekeeper's humorous complaint with a lighthearted remark.
Asks his father directly how bad the situation is, indicating awareness and engagement.
Shares a laugh with his father, showing social ease and confidence.
Does not immediately react strongly or take charge after learning the gates are broken and his father will deteriorate, suggesting some hesitation or lack of immediate problem solving.
Encourages Dad to get brothers back to reignite the fire.
Encourages Jimmy to go get brothers despite Jimmy's reluctance.
Shows concern about situation and willingness to act.
Expresses fear and reluctance about the dangerous mission and the possibility of having to kill his brothers, looks teary eyed.
Introduces himself politely to Beefy and cooperates.
Responds with humor and accepts his Dad's correction without negativity.
Recognizes the approaching light but gets hit by the train, showing lack of situational awareness.
Acknowledges his mistake with a humorous attitude ('take a mulligan'), showing resilience.
Carefully looks both ways before hopping out and crossing the tracks, demonstrating caution.
Interprets the sign with his name and communicates effectively with Beefy, showing social awareness and clarity.
Pulls out the flask trying to coax Beefy into it without verifying his identity, leading to a correction by Beefy.
Listens warily to Beefy's warning about brothers possessing people but shows some skepticism before proceeding.
Accepts Beefy's advice about needing to adapt to physical needs on Earth and prepares to acquire warm clothes.
Compliments the gatekeeper's modified bra and respects his embarrassment by agreeing to keep it secret.
Eagerly accepts Beefy's help and shows enthusiasm during the eating lesson.
Follows Beefy's instructions carefully to eat the chicken and gains joy and energy from it.
Confidently claims to have plenty of energy and is eager to proceed.
Runs off the curb directly into the path of a moving bus, resulting in him falling down.
Attempts to handle an awkward situation with the gatekeeper by making a light-hearted comment and agreeing to keep a secret.
Agrees to keep a secret for the Gatekeeper politely ('You got it').
Walks away from the Gatekeeper without engaging in the monster's inappropriate pantomime.
Expresses cautiousness and self-protection ('From now on, I'm just going to avoid all moving metal objects').
Approaches Todd nervously and politely, introducing himself sincerely as a potential roommate ('Hello, friend, my name is Nicky...').
Says 'You got it' to Gatekeeper and agrees not to tell anyone about the passage
Is described as 'crazy cautious' while walking with Beefy
Expresses intention to avoid all moving metal objects (shows awareness of danger)
Nervous and gives a practiced speech when meeting potential roommate Todd
Politely asks if he can fill the roommate slot after greeting Todd.
Laughs a little too hard at 'deep South' comment, unsure why.
Asks Todd permission to do the 'sleep thing' in the bedroom.
Asks straightforward questions about rent and household arrangements, showing willingness to understand and adapt.
Responds honestly and clearly to Todd's questions, though seems somewhat naive or inexperienced (e.g., asks 'What is rent?').
Laughs awkwardly and cannot explain why, indicating social discomfort or uncertainty.
Follows Beefy's advice to do the 'sleep thing' and confirms with Todd, showing readiness to comply and learn.
Successfully clotheslines a man on a bike and attempts to persuade him to drink a flask despite resistance.
Is kicked in the head and the target escapes despite his effort.
Approaches various people on the street offering a bottle, attempts to share.
Tries to get the cashier to drink, but accepts rejection without conflict.
Offers bottle to homeless man who accepts it, but then is met with hostility and garbage thrown at him.
Enters polar bear cage holding flask, risking personal safety.
Sits tired and beaten, eating Popeye's drumstick, showing vulnerability and exhaustion.
No visible aggressive or hostile reactions despite repeated rebuffs and physical harm (garbage throwing, death).
Tries to get the cashier to drink but is politely refused and then orders food instead, showing social adaptability.
Successfully gets a homeless man to drink but nothing happens and the man then throws garbage at him, indicating poor judgment and ineffective influence.
Approaches a polar bear holding the flask, an obviously dangerous and reckless act showing lack of prudence.
After being killed again, shoots through the firewall and engages in banter with the Gatekeeper and Monster, demonstrating resilience and situational awareness.
Sits exhausted and falls asleep after going through many challenges, showing physical and mental fatigue which limits immediate capability.
Passively sleeps despite disturbing people and animals around him.
Reacts with concern and anger when his belongings are stolen.
Politely asks for his flask back from the street vendor instead of accusing outright.
Avoids calling the vendor a thief directly, softening the confrontation.
Makes a sincere, imaginative explanation about the flask to discourage the potential buyer.
Calmly asks the Street Vendor not to raise his voice despite provocation.
Nicky's eyes start glowing red in response to threat, indicating rising anger but no immediate aggression.
Does not retaliate when the Street Vendor gets aggressive; lets Valerie intervene.
Picks up the stolen flask and drumstick without escalating the conflict.
Says 'Hey, mister. I'll be seeing you in a few years...' to the Street Vendor, implying a warning or threat.
Thanks Valerie sincerely for helping him, admits she didn't have to do that.
Laughs warmly and compliments Valerie on her glasses in a friendly manner.
Shares personal and vulnerable information about his father and his worries.
Offers Valerie the half-eaten drumstick in a friendly, generous gesture.
Follows Valerie after she walks away, engages in light-hearted conversation, and attempts to connect with her by complimenting her glasses and sharing personal background.
Laughs without knowing why and makes somewhat strange or awkward statements about his father.
Offers Valerie a drumstick in a friendly, humorous way to share food and maintain connection.
Asks Valerie to join him for Gelati in a friendly and enthusiastic manner, using playful language and laughter.
Responds warmly to Valerie wrapping the Gelati to help him with cold hands, showing appreciation.
Takes Valerie's wrist gently to smell her perfume, and expresses nervous but sincere feelings about butterflies in his stomach.
Makes a thoughtful suggestion about making drawstring pants to prevent humiliation, showing empathy and understanding.
Tries to make a light, funny comment about drawstring socks which Valerie appreciates, indicating social skill and confidence.
Accidentally says an inappropriate and confused compliment, immediately recognizes his mistake and tries to recover, showing lack of self-control and poor social competence.
Delivers an offensive and confusing line about wanting to have sex with a 'gross pig' after the slip-up, damaging relationship with Valerie and showing poor judgment.
Struggles mentally with Adrian’s intrusive influence, tries to resist but ultimately gestures rudely, causing further social harm, reflecting low self-control and competence under pressure.
Plea to Adrian to return to Hell to help their sick father, showing concern.
Reluctantly takes a soda from his roommate’s fridge after being mocked by Beefy.
Expresses doubt about his own evil compared to his brothers, indicating self-awareness and humility.
Shows passivity and apparent lack of agency when told he can’t do anything unless he learns evil powers.
Frowns and bites his lip when encouraged to release evil; hesitates rather than embraces malice.
Volunteers to take the shot when Miguel is too nervous.
Uses evil powers to explode the basketball causing chaos.
Runs over to grab the microphone to warn the crowd about their souls being in danger
Offers a deal to the crowd: if he makes the shot, ref stops bad behavior and they get free pizza
Emits a blood-curdling devil yell and performs an impressive slam dunk that excites the crowd, showing passion and skill.
Hits the ref on the way down after dunking but gets up slowly, suggesting awareness and not ignoring the ref's condition.
Says 'Never doubt my skills' after the dunk, showing confidence but potentially boastful.
Performs complex basketball moves including fakes, behind-the-back dribbling, and a powerful dunk that cracks the backboard, impressing the crowd and opponents.
Demonstrates confidence by declaring 'Never doubt my skills' after his performance.
Refuses to share the super devil juice, saying Dad said it was only for him.
Waves to the stunned but appreciative crowd after the incident with Cassius and the flask.
Seems calm and engaging with friends at Todd's apartment, participating in the discussion about music.
Takes a big bite of cake despite drugged mix, happily joins in on fun.
Reluctantly performs a silly and painful party trick to entertain friends, then shares laughs and high fives.
Shows self-deprecating humor about his age to join the joke.
Internal thought: can't stop thinking about a girl, Valerie, indicating hopeful affection.
Loosens up his neck and makes his head go around 360 degrees, entertaining the group and responding to their requests.
Takes a big bite of cake without knowing what 'reefer' is, showing a lack of knowledge about common substances.
Acknowledges feeling strange and preoccupied with thoughts of a girl, showing some self-awareness but no active problem solving.
Politely declines an invitation to prioritize giving full attention to Valerie, showing self-awareness and emotional focus.
Reflects longingly out the window, considering his feelings and next steps, then decisively asks for directions to the Parson's School of Design.
Politely declines the student's invitation but thanks him for directions and makes a playful comment.
Watches Valerie working with a warm, admiring feeling, smiling sincerely.
Tries to kiss Valerie through the window, accidentally bumps his head but remains sincere and friendly.
Shows vulnerability and humor after being maced by Valerie, admitting eyes sting and jokingly questioning his decision.
Responds to Valerie's concern with affectionate and sincere comments, e.g. 'Maybe it's because of your sweet voice' and 'you make me feel alive in a way I've never felt before.'
Apologizes politely to the student after intruding on the wrong window.
Explains his actions honestly and vulnerably to Valerie, admitting he was possessed and expressing love for his Dad and possibly Valerie.
Nervously offers his hand to Valerie and invites her to fly with him, creating a shared magical experience.
Explains complex supernatural situation clearly and calmly to Valerie, demonstrating knowledge and persuasive communication.
Gets punched in the face and flies back ten feet, showing physical vulnerability.
Shows nervousness but successfully reassures Valerie and convinces her to fly with him.
Stops to smell flowers and waves friendly to the Koreans despite their agitation.
Speaks in Korean attempting friendliness but is met with glare and confusion.
Runs from various groups (nut vendor, taxi driver, school girls, basketball players) seemingly without confrontation.
Reacting with panic and confusion trying to understand why he is being chased.
Speaks Korean to Koreans, but fails to understand their reaction, showing confusion.
Notices he is being followed by multiple people and reacts by trying to put distance between them.
Makes a last-second right turn into an alley to evade pursuers in wheelchairs, causing them to crash.
Panics and is out of breath after the chase; gets hit on the head by a bum, showing vulnerability and lack of control.
Tries to escape a dangerous mob rather than fight them aggressively
Transforms into insects to scare away the crowd, avoiding direct violence
Expresses frustration and insists innocence rather than resorting to dishonesty or blame-shifting
Does not lash out at Beefy or Todd despite their suspicion and harsh words
Expresses outrage at being falsely implicated and tries to deny his identity to protect himself.
Opens the door to friends Peter and John promptly, trusting them despite the dangerous situation.
Responds to friends' rough behavior with humor and a thumbs up despite being hurt and nearly drowned.
Commands friends to 'do me' in a joking manner before the rough play.
Expresses concern about his father's situation and the city chasing him, showing care.
Commands John and Peter confidently, setting a meeting time and issuing orders.
Responds passively to being hurt and drowned without resisting or escaping.
Shows awareness that his enemy is always a step ahead, indicating insight.
Is anticipated as a formidable figure by others (son of Satan), causing caution and respect.
Is late to the meeting point, causing concern among allies.
Remains silent and hesitant while others drink and engage, showing no active participation or confidence.
No indication of skillful or intelligent behavior; appears passive and overshadowed by others in the scene.
Resists drinking despite Adrian's threat.
Is visibly scared when Valerie is threatened, showing concern for her.
Leaps down onto the tracks, wrestles Valerie away from Adrian, and tosses her off the tracks to save her from the train.
Raises the flask to drink despite knowing the danger, indicating a willingness to follow through with a risky plan.
Responds politely to Angel and friends' excitement, but quickly tries to shift conversation to his own goal (asking about the Black Palace).
Makes a self-deprecating joke about his mother's identity and his halitosis, showing some humility and humor.
Shows genuine surprise and curiosity when Angel reveals his mother is an angel, indicating openness and sincerity.
Tries to ask directions to the Black Palace and attempts to check in with his dad confidently.
Fails to understand the setting and the nature of the place he is in, showing confusion when the angels laugh at him.
Responds with a joking comment about his mom being a mountain goat, indicating lack of serious understanding.
Is receptive and curious when told new information about his heritage, showing openness to learn.
Is confused and stunned by Angel's age explanation and by casual banter.
Mentioned as having 'come through' a difficult situation when others doubted it.
Asks a relevant question about family relations, showing engagement and curiosity.
Responds politely by saying 'Well tell her I said hi back' when Angel relays a greeting.
Shows polite social interaction and light humor in conversation with Angel and others.
Admits unfamiliarity or inability to mambo when asked by Chubbs.
Shows concern for Dad by asking how Adrian got the throne and if Dad is okay.
Asks how Angel could see him, showing curiosity and desire to understand surveillance.
Comments quickly on seeing Dad's throne and questions Adrian's possession and Dad's wellbeing, indicating alertness and situational awareness.
Shows concern for Valerie's crying and expresses a strong desire to help her, his dad, and everybody.
Expresses determination to help Valerie, dad, and everybody despite being shocked.
Jokes about his speech impediment and shares a light moment with friends, showing humor and openness.
Asks Angel if he can call her Mommy and hugs her, demonstrating affection and sincerity.
Admits he is starting to panic and worries about being weaker and less smart than Adrian.
Engages in lighthearted banter to ease tension, showing social awareness and confidence.
Accepts a mysterious powerful object (the jewelled ball) without full understanding but remains calm and trusting.
Hugs his Mom and then declares confidence to face the challenge ahead.
Upon facing imminent danger (15 demons), closes his eyes and concentrates to use his power.
Calms attacking demons by releasing positive, gentle elements (butterflies, rabbits, fried chicken) to change their mood and encourage friendliness.
Leads a small army of reformed demons with a golden light/haze of good around them
Asks Adrian nicely, in the name of all that is good, to release friends and surrender
Steps forward bravely when his army is shaken and threatened
Leads an army of reformed demons with a golden light/haze of good, confronts Adrian and demands the release of his friends confidently and peacefully.
Steps forward bravely after the army of good is shaken and some demons doubt their power.
Uses magic to create a rainbow and a cute chipmunk, eliciting applause from the crowd.
Turns a dangerous python into a row of flowers.
Transforms a threatening gardener with a lawn mower into a mother pushing a newborn baby carriage.
Changes a threatening evil dwarf to a hot girl dwarf, calming the conflict and fostering positivity.
Allows himself to be physically attacked by Adrian without retaliation.
Steps forward bravely to confront Adrian despite threat.
Creates a rainbow and cute chipmunk as a skillful use of power.
Quickly transforms threatening magic (snake, gardener) into harmless or positive forms (flowers, mother with baby, hot girl dwarf).
Is punched hard and knocked off platform but cushioned by unseen support, indicating some lack of control over immediate physical outcome.
Engages Adrian in playful pillow fight instead of immediate hostility
Attempts to calmly ask Adrian to get in the flask before escalating
Physically slams Adrian into the bed headboard during conflict
Grabs Adrian's coat tail and drags him into the flask to help in the struggle.
Emerges victorious from the struggle, leading others to cheer for him.
Grabs Adrian's coat tail and yanks him into the flask to avoid being trapped alone.
Successfully escapes the flask after the struggle, emerging to cheers.
Allows Valerie to hug him and engages in a kiss, sharing a moment of affection.
Continues kissing Valerie beyond her comfort, pressing harder as she struggles for air and laughs while doing so.
Responds to Valerie's encouragement to 'do it for the butterflies' and manages to break free, showing responsiveness and sensitivity.
Quickly acts to summon Ozzy Osborne to fight Adrian, showing protectiveness and quick thinking on behalf of his friends.
Thinks quickly and uses the ball given by his mom to summon Ozzy Osborne to help fight Adrian.
Turns into Adrian during the kiss, causing distress to Valerie and stopping the crowd's cheering.
Hands a big rock to Valerie and asks her to 'do me,' accepting her love and willingness to kill him to save others.
Expresses love sincerely to Valerie before being killed by her.
Speaks calmly about going to Heaven and tries to release the evil, showing focus and acceptance of consequences.
Focuses and commands 'Release the Evil' to cover Henry Winkler in bees, showing control and quick thinking.
Carries out a self-sacrificial act by having Valerie kill him to save others, indicating ability to make difficult decisions skillfully.
Expresses intention to 'just go to Heaven' when advised to kill himself, showing self-awareness and confidence in his plan.
Expresses that he came through for Dad, Mom, and the butterflies, showing consideration and care.
Pats Dad on the back after promising to take care of the middle ground, showing sincerity and friendliness.
Successfully saves the universe, earns the praise and trust of his dad.
Reassures his dad confidently about taking care of the middle realm.
Expresses affection and loyalty toward family and home, showing emotional intelligence.
Tries to resist the possession of his hand but fails and screams.
Responds to Dad in a calm, humorous manner by saying he is 'just re-arranging the furniture' after the possession incident.
Smiles at Dad's wink, showing some confidence and connection with his father.
Shows initiative by nearly finishing his 'monsters of metal compilation tape' and expressing pride in it to Dad.
Starts to file out calmly after Dad's decision without protest or hesitation.
Creates and shares a metal mix tape thoughtfully designed to affect mood, showing awareness of emotional impact.
Playfully corrects Dad on Metallica's name, showing confidence and knowledge of music.
Expresses doubt and fear about the mission, saying he's never been to Earth or slept over at someone else's house.
Despite fear and lack of experience, accepts the mission to go to Earth and confront his brothers after being pushed through fire.
Looks teary eyed and petrified when confronted with the gravity of his task, showing emotional reaction but not paralysis.
Breaks through a solid fire wall and arrives on Earth, seemingly adapting quickly to new environment.
Looks at Beefy warily but quickly apologizes when mistaken about Beefy being possessed.
Shivers and admits to feeling cold, showing vulnerability.
Snores loudly and is asleep in public, unaware of surroundings.
Reacts quickly to loss of flask by immediately attempting to identify direction of thief.
Uses a humorous and confident line: 'A million angry octopus people couldn't hold me back!'
Is unsure about the exact location of his own apartment but relies on his dog's knowledge instead.
Responds naturally and socially engages in conversation with Valerie, showing ease and confidence.
Focuses his energy on creating beautiful things rather than on appearance, showing self-awareness and productive redirection.
Engages in lighthearted conversation with Valerie, recognizing and expressing his feelings about butterflies in his stomach with some humor.
Tries to persuade Adrian to return to Hell to fix the broken gates and save their father.
Loses control over his body and walks crazily into the street, endangering himself.
Frowns and bites his lip while staring at the can, showing hesitation and uncertainty about releasing the evil within him.
Does not act on Beefy's challenge to release evil and instead keeps to himself, showing lack of confidence or ability to use power.
Recognizes and connects the ref's snapping fingers to someone he knows, indicating observation and quick association.
Races for the door after the observation, showing decisiveness and quick response.
Throws an underhand shot with intent to score despite challenging circumstances.
Negotiates with the ref to get another chance with a clear plan and stakes.
Uses humor and offers incentives (free pizza) to rally the crowd's support.
Struggles to get attention and respect initially (getting hit by a hot dog, being ignored).
Refuses to give the 'super devil juice' flask to Regis, adhering to his father's instructions, showing caution and responsibility.
Uses the flask in an apparently clever way to trap Cassius inside it, successfully subduing him and impressing the crowd.
Responds calmly and confidently to the stunned crowd after the event, indicating poise under pressure.
Interprets the backward message on a James Taylor album, demonstrating curiosity and analytical thought.
Calmly handles the disruptive preacher by using a clever method (fire hydrant water blast) to stop him.
Declines to fly over Central Park as requested, showing thoughtful prioritization by wanting to share a meaningful moment first.
Plans a romantic moment (sharing a beautiful experience) with Valerie, demonstrating emotional intelligence and thoughtful timing.
Tries to deny identity and avoid mob by denying being at location and refusing to engage.
Shows clear outrage and frustration at false accusations but does not formulate a plan or respond effectively to crisis.
Opens door to friends amid threatening mob situation, allowing allies in for support.
Calmly handles a chaotic situation with the baby Zachariah's fire breathing and corrects the baby politely.
Allows a public incident where a baby singes an old lady's eyebrows, showing limited foresight or control.
